verse.roman:
na vai te 'jita bhaktānāṁ
mamāham iti mādhava
tvaṁ taveti ca nānā-dhīḥ
paśūnām iva vaikṛtī

synonyms: na—not; vai—indeed; te—Your; ajita—O unconquerable one; bhaktānām—of the devotees; mama aham iti—"mine" and "I"; mādhava—O Kṛṣṇa; tvam tava iti—"you" and "yours"; ca—and; nānā—of differences; dhīḥ—mentality; paśūnām—of animals; iva—as if; vaikṛtī—perverted.
translation: O unconquerable Mādhava, even Your devotees make no distinctions of "I" and "mine," "you" and "yours," for this is the perverted mentality of animals.

purport.text: An ordinary person thinks, "I am so attractive, intelligent and wealthy that people should simply serve me and do what I want. Why should I obey anyone else?" This proud, separatist mentality is also found in animals who battle one another for supremacy. Such a mentality is conspicuously absent in the mind of an advanced devotee, and it is certainly absent in the sublime, omniscient mind of the Supreme Personality of Godhead.
